tier.item: Ni soniodd Sioned ddim am y di
SN mention.PAST.3SG Sioned SN about the event
The Old English example (8a) is from Mazzon (2004). The Romance examples in (8b, c) are from
Zanuttini (1991, 1994). The Welsh examples (8e, f) are from Borsley and Jones (2005). The examples
from Kanakura (8g) and Ewe (8h) are from Dryer (2006). Kanakura is a West Chadic language spoken
in Nigeria. Ewe is a Kwa language spoken in Ghana.
`Sioned did not talk about the event.'
Ni soniodd Sioned ddim am y di gwyddiad.[formal Welsh]
SN mention.PAST.3SG Sioned SN about the event
The Old English example (8a) is from Mazzon (2004). The Romance examples in (8b, c) are from
Zanuttini (1991, 1994). The Welsh examples (8e, f) are from Borsley and Jones (2005). The examples
from Kanakura (8g) and Ewe (8h) are from Dryer (2006). Kanakura is a West Chadic language spoken
in Nigeria. Ewe is a Kwa language spoken in Ghana.
Sioned did not talk about the event.

I don't mind them being allowed to stay longer
lit. "it's alright for me [for them to get to stay longer]
(i) gofynnodd i Aled i Mair gael dod allan i chwarae
asked to A. to M. be.allowed to.come out to play
"s/he asked Aled for Mair to be allowed to come out to play" (David Willis, p.c.)
gofynnodd i Aled i Mair gael dod allan i chwarae
asked to A. to M. be.allowed to.come out to play
s/he asked Aled for Mair to be allowed to come out to play" (David Willis, p.c.)
